channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Zephyr: Direct Distillation of LM Alignment
item.description: Starting from a dataset of outputs ranked by a teacher model, we apply distilled direct preference optimization (dDPO) to learn a chat model with significantly improved intent alignment.

item.title: Lumos: Learning Agents with Unified Data, Modular Design, and Open-Source LLMs
item.description: Leveraging this unified data and modular design, Lumos not only achieves comparable or superior performance to current, state-of-the-art agents, but also exhibits several key advantages: (1) Lumos surpasses GPT-4/3. 5-based agents in complex question answering and web tasks, while equalling the performance of significantly larger LLM agents on math tasks; (2) Lumos outperforms open-source agents created through conventional training methods and those using chain-of-thoughts training; and (3) Lumos is capable of effectively generalizing to unseen interactive tasks, outperforming larger LLM-based agents and even exceeding performance of specialized agents.

item.title: LocoMuJoCo: A Comprehensive Imitation Learning Benchmark for Locomotion
item.description: Imitation Learning (IL) holds great promise for enabling agile locomotion in embodied agents.

item.title: LCM-LoRA: A Universal Stable-Diffusion Acceleration Module
item.description: Latent Consistency Models (LCMs) have achieved impressive performance in accelerating text-to-image generative tasks, producing high-quality images with minimal inference steps.

item.title: How Can Recommender Systems Benefit from Large Language Models: A Survey
item.description: For the "WHERE" question, we discuss the roles that LLM could play in different stages of the recommendation pipeline, i. e., feature engineering, feature encoder, scoring/ranking function, and pipeline controller.

item.title: S-LoRA: Serving Thousands of Concurrent LoRA Adapters
item.description: To capitalize on these opportunities, we present S-LoRA, a system designed for the scalable serving of many LoRA adapters.

item.title: GLM-130B: An Open Bilingual Pre-trained Model
item.description: We introduce GLM-130B, a bilingual (English and Chinese) pre-trained language model with 130 billion parameters.

item.title: On the Road with GPT-4V(ision): Early Explorations of Visual-Language Model on Autonomous Driving
item.description: This has been a significant bottleneck, particularly in the development of common sense reasoning and nuanced scene understanding necessary for safe and reliable autonomous driving.

item.title: Punica: Multi-Tenant LoRA Serving
item.description: Our scheduler consolidates multi-tenant LoRA serving workloads in a shared GPU cluster.

item.title: Multi-view Self-supervised Disentanglement for General Image Denoising
item.description: It is understandable as the model is designed to learn paired mapping (e. g. from a noisy image to its clean version).

item.title: Language Models are Super Mario: Absorbing Abilities from Homologous Models as a Free Lunch
item.description: Based on this observation, we further sparsify delta parameters of multiple SFT homologous models with DARE and subsequently merge them into a single model by parameter averaging.

item.title: iTransformer: Inverted Transformers Are Effective for Time Series Forecasting
item.description: These forecasters leverage Transformers to model the global dependencies over temporal tokens of time series, with each token formed by multiple variates of the same timestamp.

item.title: LLaVA-Med: Training a Large Language-and-Vision Assistant for Biomedicine in One Day
item.description: In this paper, we propose a cost-efficient approach for training a vision-language conversational assistant that can answer open-ended research questions of biomedical images.

item.title: GLaMM: Pixel Grounding Large Multimodal Model
item.description: In this work, we present Grounding LMM (GLaMM), the first model that can generate natural language responses seamlessly intertwined with corresponding object segmentation masks.

item.title: CogVLM: Visual Expert for Pretrained Language Models
item.description: We introduce CogVLM, a powerful open-source visual language foundation model.

item.title: VideoReTalking: Audio-based Lip Synchronization for Talking Head Video Editing In the Wild
item.description: Our system disentangles this objective into three sequential tasks: (1) face video generation with a canonical expression; (2) audio-driven lip-sync; and (3) face enhancement for improving photo-realism.

item.title: Distil-Whisper: Robust Knowledge Distillation via Large-Scale Pseudo Labelling
item.description: As the size of pre-trained speech recognition models increases, running these large models in low-latency or resource-constrained environments becomes challenging.

item.title: Large Language Models Are Reasoning Teachers
item.description: We evaluate our method on a wide range of public models and complex tasks.

item.title: Set-of-Mark Prompting Unleashes Extraordinary Visual Grounding in GPT-4V
item.description: We present Set-of-Mark (SoM), a new visual prompting method, to unleash the visual grounding abilities of large multimodal models (LMMs), such as GPT-4V.

item.title: OtterHD: A High-Resolution Multi-modality Model
item.description: In this paper, we present OtterHD-8B, an innovative multimodal model evolved from Fuyu-8B, specifically engineered to interpret high-resolution visual inputs with granular precision.
